alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 13 at 3:26AM CDT until October 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Today and Across Portions of the Area Friday... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AND NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS AND PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 80... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Red Flag Warning for this afternoon through early evening, and a Fire Weather Watch for Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * WINDS...Today, Northwest sustained 20 to 30 mph, with gusts 35 to 45 mph. On Friday, West sustained 15 to 25 mph, with gusts 30 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For today, as low as 15 to 20 percent. On Friday, as low as 18 to 23 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
